'''''SEVEN 2''''' is the second volume of the [[Marion E. Wade Center]]'s annual journal ''[[SEVEN]]'', published in March [[1981]].<ref name="jstor" />
==Contents==
*"The Emperor Clothed and in his Right Mind?"
**By: Richard Webster
*"The Nature of Meaning"
**By: [[Owen Barfield]]
*"The Abyss of His Mother-Tongue: Scotch Dialect in Novels by George MacDonald"
**By: Roderick McGillis
*"''The Everlasting Man'': G.K. Chesterton's Answer to H.G. Wells"
**By: John Sullivan
*"C.S. Lewis: Critic, Creator, and Cult Figure"
**By: Chad Walsh
*"Dorothy L. Sayers and the Other Type of Mystery"
**By: John R. Elliott, Jr.
*"Types of Christian Drama: With Some Notes on Production"
**By: Dorothy L. Sayers
*"The Diagrammatised Glory of Williams's ''Taliessin through Logres''"
**By: Joe McClatchey<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/article_index|articlename=Contents By Volume|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=13 August 2025}}</ref>
